bestBHT.bht: Despite Jesus commanding the man to stay silent about his healing, the news of the miraculous cure spread rapidly and the crowds kept coming together to be healed of their infirmities. The more Jesus charged the man to keep silent, the more the news blazed abroad, fueling the excitement and gratitude of those who experienced the healing. The fame of Jesus grew and circulated throughout the region, drawing in great multitudes who came together to hear his teachings and seek healing from him.

Henry Alford: 15.] The reason of this is stated in Mark, ver. 45, to be the disobedience of the leper to the Lord’s command.
Marvin Vincent: Went abroad [διηρχετο] . Dia, throughout the region. Wyc., the word walked about.
Came together [συνηρχοντο] Imperfect. Kept coming together, or were coming.
To be healed [θεραπευεσθαι] . Originally, to be an attendant, to do service; and therefore of a physician, to attend upon, or treat medically.
Archibald T. Robertson: So much the more (μαλλον). Mark 1:45 has only 'much' (πολλα, many), but Mark tells more about the effect of this disobedience.
Went abroad (διηρχετο). Imperfect tense. The fame of Jesus kept going.
Came together (συνηρχοντο). Imperfect tense again. The more the report spread, the more the crowds came.
John Gill: For the more he charged the man to keep silence, the more he blazed it abroad, being elated with the cure he received, and filled with gratitude to his benefactor." (Luke 5:15)
And great multitudes came together to hear: him, or from him, as the Syriac, Arabic, Persic, and Ethiopic versions add; to hear the doctrines of the Gospel preached by him." (Luke 5:15)
To be healed by him of their infirmities; their bodily weaknesses and disorders." (Luke 5:15)

bhtAttempts.bht: Despite Jesus commanding the man to stay quiet about his healing, the news spread rapidly and the crowds kept coming. The more Jesus tried to suppress the news, the more it blazed abroad. This led to great multitudes coming together to hear Jesus preach and seek healing from Him for their bodily weaknesses and disorders. The fame of Jesus and His ability to heal continued to go throughout the region, drawing people from all around.

Despite his command to keep silent, the news of the man's healing continued to spread far and wide. As a result, more and more people came together to hear Jesus preach and seek healing for their bodily infirmities. The fame of Jesus grew and circulated throughout the region, causing crowds from every direction to gather in anticipation of witnessing his miracles and receiving his healing touch.

Despite Jesus commanding the man to stay silent about his healing, the news of the miraculous cure spread rapidly and the crowds kept coming together to be healed of their infirmities. The more Jesus charged the man to keep silent, the more the news blazed abroad, fueling the excitement and gratitude of those who experienced the healing. The fame of Jesus grew and circulated throughout the region, drawing in great multitudes who came together to hear his teachings and seek healing from him.

Despite Jesus commanding the man to stay silent, the news of his healing spread rapidly, causing crowds to gather for healing. The more Jesus charged the man to keep silent, the more the news blazed abroad, fueling excitement. The fame of Jesus grew, drawing in multitudes who sought healing.

Despite Jesus commanding the man to keep silent, news of his healing spread rapidly throughout the region. The more Jesus urged the man to stay quiet, the more the news blazed abroad, igniting excitement and gratitude among those who witnessed the miraculous cure. The fame of Jesus continued to grow, attracting great multitudes of people seeking to hear his teachings and receive healing for their physical ailments and weaknesses.
